description: ERECTION OF A FIRST FLOOR REAR EXTENSION.
decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The proposed first floor rear extension by reason of its size and siting is considered an unneighbourly form of development which is visually intrusive, overly dominant and harmful to the amenity of neighbours due to loss of outlook and sense of enclosure contrary to the principles of policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policy DMD2 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014. 
Reason : 2 - The proposed first floor rear extension by reason of design, siting, scale, height, materials, proportions and massing, represents an overly large, unduly dominant and visually intrusive form of development that fails to respect or complement the original building, and would detract from the locally distinctive pattern of development along this part of Tamworth Park that is readily visible from Worthington Close, contrary to policies 7.4 of the London Plan 2016, LBM Core Strategy Policy CS14 and policies DM D2 and DM D3 of the Merton Adopted Sites and Policies Plan (2014).   

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
 Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
